content.description:
The sit start adds a mini-crux before the rest prior to finishing

Anger Management

.

youtu.be/R0fZJhZM_6M
content.location:
Sit start on two crimps at the back of the cave, right of the

Anger Management

start. This uses the same sit start as per Spray Center Sit.

content.description:
Start on the first two bolts of

Spew

and fire straight up to

Rapture's

anchors.  One of the best and most direct lines on the wall.  I don't know if I officially have the FA or not.  Either way it is a great route that I know will get a lot of traffic.  No clue on the grade either 13c or d other sends will tell.

This is the direct start to the finish of

Spray

. Start with tip toes on the sharp, pointed boulder below. Left hand on foothold crimp and right hand on long crimp jug. Follow a couple of crimpy holds into the large underclings then finish on

Spray

.
content.protection: Bolts. Top-rope start. Pre-clip the two bolts on either side of the underclings.

content.description:
Start in the same place as the

Dark Art

, then head left following the bolts.  The only real danger is halfway through - there is serious back slapping potential with the spray boulder. Bring a pad and have a good belayer, and you should be fine.

This route takes the prominent line out the hanging arete via multiple seams and slopers.  Start by preclipping the first two bolts, as the start is very awkward stepping off the ledge and onto the route.  The crux hits right of the deck with a very difficult cross through on small holds which leads to a foot cutting throw to the big, obvious chalked jug.  From here on out, it's stamina and accuracy that will determine success.  Mid route at the fifth bolt, it is advisable to have a long draw to clip, because the clipping holds there are not great.  Technical, powerful, sloping, and continuous, this route is a must do at the grade.
content.location:
This route takes the line straight out the hanging arete on the left side of the Spray Wall proper.  It is left of

Rapture

.

content.description: Characterized by a perfect, 30-degree overhanging wall with a big, chalk-coated flake at the second bolt, this climb offers multiple dynamic cruxes on perfect stone. The first crux is between the first and second bolt which is characterized by a technical highstep and right-hand sidepull which leads you to the big flake at the second bolt. A bit of a reprieve before cruising through the sloppy, left-trending seam. Then, the second redpoint crux of dynoing four feet from the first seam to the second higher one at the fifth bolt. A worthy tick with satisfying moves on awesome stone.
content.location:
It heads straight up and right from the start of the neighboring arete climb,

Spew

.

content.description: This has got to be one of my all time favorite sport climbs in Elevenmile Canyon. Interesting and fun movement up a wall that continues to get steeper as you go. Fight the pump at the top and go for it. Good clean fall if you get burnt off.
content.location: Continue past the super steep and difficult climbs for 30 yards, and look for a black water streak on the top of grey rock. It is the most obvious route up the face. This route is between Dad Speaks Parley and Dan Speaks Darrly

content.description:
Start on the slab and move immediately left to the crack.  Head up through the roof and trend Left.  Shares the same slab bolt as

Only Entertainment

then follow up and left to

Rapture's

anchors.
content.protection: 5 bolts plus two for the anchors.

content.description:
With the generous permission of Ian-Spencer Green and Stewart, I rebolted part of

Pagan Wisdom

and this route to yield a clean, impressive, and futuristic line that used to be called "New Dawn Fades".  This route starts just right of

Rapture

, and follows two bolts of 5.10 climbing to an absolutely show stopping, 8 foot dyno from sloping jugs to a brick in the roof (which has room for one hand, slopes the wrong way and is harder to hold than a greased pig!), then finish up the "easier" part of the climb,

Pagan Wisdom

.

The name implies a bizarre explosion, which is what's needed to get through the crux....
content.location:
Right smack in the middle of the Spray Wall shield, below

Pagan Wisdom

....

climbs.name: Only Entertainment
climbs.fa: Equipped by Mike Johnson  FFA: Ian Spencer Green

content.description:
This beautiful route takes the center line straight out the middle of the right side of the Spray Wall proper.  This is pristine crimp pulling at its finest.

Start with a slab move that is quite a bit harder than it looks (5.12-), then head straight up to the body jam no-hands rest at the break before busting out the main headwall.  This route is super continuous and ultra technical, with very satisfying moves the entire way.  It's really amazing on this route what you can pull off of on this climb.  The crux hits right around the 5th bolt and ends at the break before the slight runout at the top, precision will pay off well here.

Overall, this is possibly the best route at the Spray Wall, in my opinion.
content.protection: 8 bolts and cold shuts at the station.
content.location: This takes the main line straight up the middle of the right side of the Spray Wall proper.

content.description:
Start up the slab just right of

Only Entertainment

and mantle onto the ledge (which is currently really dirty).  Head straight up utilizing multiple sidepulls.  At the 4th bolt, there is a huge flake on the left that is really hollow and flexes - BE VERY CAREFUL - it will come off and probably wreck your belayer.  The route is actually pretty fun and has relatively sustained climbing.  For full value, avoid stemming out right or traversing to stand on the ledge. If it wasn't for the corner on the right, this route would be just as classic as the rest of the routes on the Spray Wall.
content.location:
It is just right of

Only Entertainment

.

content.description:
Start sitting with incut holds infront of a low mini-cave. Climb up and trend right through more incuts to a crux stab to a sloping shelf.  Top out is easy, but thought provoking.  This is not a highball but swings off the crux stab tend to eject climbers downhill.  Our crew had at least one bloody cartwheel event.

V5/7.

climbs.name: Darrelict of Dialect (submitted as Dan Speaks Darrly)

content.description: This route has fun technical stemming on not so great rock to a large huck at the end before the anchors. It is a harder route if you are shorter.
content.location:
The next route left of

Randy Speaks Farsi

. Find the right facing dihedral with poor rock at the start. This route and Dan Speaks Darrly are the only two route on this wall.

content.description:
This route takes the prominent line out fixed chain quickdraws on the 45 degree overhang next to the big boulder.

Start by preclipping the first bolt (this is absolutly essential for safety, or you will go flying into and break your back on the boulder at the base of the climb, laying down crashpads is also a good idea). The crux (which gone through numerous evolutions,changing the grade from .13b, to .13d) is right below the first bolt, consisting of some technical dynamic trickery with tiny sharp crimps.  This is a V8 dyno to a glued on ear, which seemes to alternate from glued on one year to off another, right now it is glued on.  After that its two huge feet cutting dynos out right to a technical dropknee move, then bust the final V6 slopey/crimpy/undercling crux over the lip to the anchors.

NOTE: almost this entire route is manufactured, and I hesitated putting it on here because of all of the flack the route would receive.  So please take it as it is, and understand it was put up in an era when "experimental" new routing was accepted.

Very powerful and dynamic, fun moves.
content.location: On the left 45 degree wall above the huge boulder, this route takes fixed chain quickdraws out its right side.

content.description:
Bolted and sent on Father's Day, this new route is a brilliant moderate addition to the Spray Wall.  The route follows the right-facing dihedral left of

Randy Speaks Farsi

, and then busts out underclings, crimps, and the final juggy roof via three cruxes.  It is recommended to stick clip the first bolt, as the slab crux right off the ground is tenuous, and there was no good place to put the bolt where it would not be in the way.  Destined to be a classic....
content.protection: Five bolts to a chain anchor. There are biners at the top for easy lowering, don't steal them.
content.location:
On the right side of the Spray Wall amphitheatre, this is the 3rd route to the left of the edge of the wall.  It follows the right-facing dihedral in the middle of the wall up increasinly overhanging climbing to a scoop, and then out the steep roof left of

Randy Speaks Farsi

.

content.description: Start matched on the obvious loaf.  Press right out to crimp.  Then bump left hand to sloper which sets you up for the massive drive by move to a uncling/sidepull crimp.  Squeeze really hard climb out the prow and finish on the arete.  Try not to dab.  Would be one star if the drive by move wasn't so amazing!
content.location: On the backside of the smaller of the 2 spray boulders.  It is the dagger looking feature.

content.description: Sit start on the left most big flake system on the boulder.  Move up on the flakes and head left to some side pulls then with your right hand grab a horrible crimp or sidepull.  I originally found hard beta that worked for me V11/12 (my best guess), then Emerson came and figured out easier beta V10, so I met the grade in the middle V11.
content.location: This is on Spray Boulder underneath the Spray Wall.
